posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
Hi Guys,


Is anyone able to use the old ECB build search at the moment ?

I've been trying to get on for the last couple of days but it keeps coming up with webpage not found.

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content: Looks like the domain expired.  I'll contribute $20USD if someone wants to bring it back.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content: I'm also willing to chip in if we can find out who we need to contact.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content: I don't think the domain expired - most of the comcast.net urls get redirected to xfinity.com urls, though it looks like the actual data wasn't migrated. I'm guessing this is comcast's way of consolidating under their xfinity brand and getting rid of old content that was just sitting there from old accounts.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
I honestly hope someone still has a backup somewhere and that it all hasn't been lost for good.

I normally browse that at least once a day.

posts.author: knives
posts.content: Any news on this? I used the build search quite regularly and would like to see it back up again. I'd be happy to contribute to hosting costs, if it's known who has the data and it can be recovered.

posts.author: Templar
posts.content: I've got the lvl 30 build search saved. not the lvl 40 one sadly

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
I have left a message with The_Krit who manages the nwn wiki and is involved with WoG.

He says he has files that may be backups but hasn't looked any further yet as they still need to find a new host. (The search was part of WoG's homepage so they need to rehost the whole lot)

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Epic Character Builders
 - a migration project I recently created on the Neverwinter Vault when I saw that ComCast had pulled the rug out from under WoG's account as it transitioned over to their stinkin' cloud Xfinity server.

Once you have decompressed the 8Mb file, you can run the search locally super fast with your browser and get all the same builds since TK compiled them just before the IGN Vault did its death spiral. Hence, it's as comprehensive as you are going to get. You can even merge the NWN2 builds using the ancillary project dedicated for that game if you are so disposed.

Besides, TK always has several oars in the water at one time with all his NWN connections so who knows when/if a new host is even in the offing.

I am still trying to compile a dynamic engine that would combine all that legacy stuff and the builds posted here, but don't hold your breath because I'm attempting it solo.  It's on my wish list, though.

Hip by any other name is still, unfortunately... Hip.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
Thanks Hip !

I did look on the vault but could only find the NWN2 archive.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Kalistez wrote:
Thanks Hip !

I did look on the vault but could only find the NWN2 archive.
No problem, mate!  It was loaded only in the last few days

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
The page opens up fine but when running the search, the results are coming up with 'Database not found'.

Any ideas ?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Kalistez wrote:
The page opens up fine but when running the search, the results are coming up with 'Database not found'.

Any ideas ?
Check what decompressed on my machine with yours.  These are the filenames and sizes but running the first search could possibly alter the file sizes slightly depending where all the results get stored.  There should be no null files, though, and the data folder should match exactly.
 
3 folders should have been decompressed like this:

folder: builds (subfolder: data - 3,760 html files, 53.6 mb)

folder: buildsearch
ECB_config.js - 1.09 kb
ECB_list.txt - 173 kb
ECB_list_doc.txt - 1.33 kb
ECB_listload.js - 5.04 kb
ECB_results.html - 0.8 kb
ECB_results.js - 28.7 kb
ECB_search.css - 2.69 kb
ECB_search.html - 12.4 kb  <----------- open this file to trigger search
ECB_search.js - 10.4 kb
ECB_search_r.css - 1.18 kb
ECB_search_s.css - 3.3 kb

folder: images (subfolder: smiles) - 18.1 kb

I run ECB_search.html from the buildsearch folder (no shortcut).  I never get "Database not found" only "Matches found: 0" if it can't locate any build matching criteria.

If all on your machine seems to match above, I would check the protections on folders and files. If not, delete and try re-decompressing. Or perhaps try opening with a different browser.  This is javascript so it must be enabled in the browser, of course.  Most installations enable it by default but never hurts to check.

I am running Win7 Pro Firefox, for what that's worth.  If you upgraded to Win10, sorry, I can't offer any suggestions as I am avoiding it like the plague.  Hopefully, you will stumble upon the resolution even by accident and if you find some adjustment was needed either per your browser or OS, be sure to publish any fix along with your rig's specs.  Keep us posted, please.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
/sigh !

Forgot that Chrome no longer supports Java.

Working perfectly in Firefox.

Thanks again for the archive, and the help getting it working !

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
